39461334.review:
[h1]※事前にインターネット検索しないで遊ぶことを推奨します[/h1]
「ゆめにっき」でインターネット検索すると、感想やレビューだけでなく、考察も多くでてきます。
ゲーム中の人物やオブジェクトには説明も解説も無いに等しいため様々な考察がなされておりますが、あくまでも他人の考察です。
初めて遊ぶ人は検索せず、一通り遊びましょう。遊んでから検索する方が、ゲームも考察も楽しめます。


[h1]エンディングはあるが、ストーリーは無い！[/h1]
誰かを助けるわけでも、絶対悪な敵を倒すわけでもなく、ただ夢の中を探索するゲームです。


[h1]主人公の見た目が変わる様々なエフェクト！[/h1]
このゲームのシステムで特徴的なのが、夢の世界で見つける事ができるエフェクトというアイテム。
夢の中の様々な場所にあり、夢の中でのみ使用することができる。
エフェクトを使用することによって主人公の見た目が変わり、様々な能力を使うことができるようになる。


[h1]迷路のような夢の世界で迷子体験！[/h1]
夢の中の世界は空間の歪んだ迷路のように迷いやすい。
気がついたら同じところをぐるぐると回っている、なんてことも。
迷ってしまったり、袋小路に入ってしまった場合はほっぺたをつねって目覚める(キーボードの9を押す)か、とあるエフェクトの能力で脱出しましょう。


[h1]様々なイベントを探そう！[/h1]
夢の中の世界はただ広いだけではなく、様々なイベントが用意されています。
エフェクトの能力で発生するものだけでなく、確率で発生するものもあります。
中にはドッキリするようなイベントも……


[h1]最後に[/h1]
[spoiler]モノ子ッッ可愛いよおかわいいいよォモノ子ォォアアァァア アァッ！！[/spoiler]

39460562.review:
I used to play this quite a bit a while ago.
You'll be spending so much time just walking around hoping to find the right NPCs.
Or just anything, since many of the dream worlds are pretty much barren, but that's not a bad thing!
You'll collect a lot of transformations, dubbed 'effects' and while most of them do interact with certain NPCs, some are totally useless, but it's fun to experiment each one with every NPC you come across so you might trigger an event and maybe get some more of the game's mysterious lore.
Warning: This game can be creepy and outright disturbing sometimes, but for the most part it's just trippy and fun!

Can't wait for the sequel (?) !

39459532.review:
One of the best indie games ever existed since it's rather an obscure game before it gets popular. I played this game first in 2015 from fan translation version, but stopped since its gameplay was very confused to me. In mid-2017 I play it again and realized that Yume Nikki is such a beautiful game. Back then the fandom is pretty small, now released on Steam probably bring more people to play this wonderful game.

The game started as a young woman named Madotsuki, who seemed couldn't get out from her room, the only choice she has is sleeping on the bed. From this Madotsuki will have a surreal adventure through many doors placed in the world which is called The Nexus. Madotsuki will find the power called "effects" which make her interaction in the dream more profitable, and can used for some NPCs if you curious what their reaction like. There are many events in the game that may surprise you, whether you did it accidentally or not.

There's no "true" goal in this game, no significant plot and no dialog you can find in the game. You can play it casually or wanted to collect all "effects" if you want.

Yume Nikki is not for everyone, but if you enjoy the aesthetic over surreal things around the bizzare world like Yume Nikki, or beautiful composition music that make you want to sleep, this is probably the best choice for you.

39459120.review:
Всегда хотел поиграть в игру, где можно побывать во сне и Yume Nikki - та самая игра. По сюжету, главная героиня игры, Мадоцуки заперта в своей комнате и единственный путь - спать и путешествовать по своим сновидениям. 

Основная суть игры - это путешествовать по снам, собирать так называемые "Эффекты", с помощью которых, можно увидеть концовку игры. Чтобы открыть концовку, нам нужно собрать 24 эффекта. Впринципе, собрать их все не составит особого труда, разве что на их поиски займут немало времени.

Как я уже говорил: Основное место игры - это наши сновидения. Каждый сон обладает своими антуражем и степенью психоделичности, что, кстати, хорошо, ведь это сон, а сон, по сути должен выглядить таким. Есть и такие моменты, где в каком-нибудь локации понадобиться какой-нибудь эффект, который поможет нам продвинуться дальше. Естественно, эти эффекты нужно искать в других локациях.

Музыка в игре зацикленная, с длительностью 2-4 секунды. Довольно хорошо вписывается в атмосферу и особо не режит уши (ну по крайней мере у меня не было такого).

Графон и оформление в игре выглядит хорошо, что и на момент 2003 года, что и сейчас, в 2018 году. Кстати говоря, стимовская же версия выглядит куда лучше интернет-версии, что очень хорошо. Даже есть вероятность того, что некоторые персонажи Undertale были срисованы с персонажей этой игры (Фриск-Мадоцуки, Гастер - Убоа)

Yume Nikki - довольно интересная игра, способная затянуть на несколько часов. Я не ожидал увидеть эту игру в стиме, но она все же появилась и как я понял, ожидается продолжение. Ждем-с!

39455158.review:
RPGツクール製の探索ゲームという認識です。

夢に入り、部屋から出るといくつもの扉がある空間に入り、どの扉からも自由に探索できる。

エフェクトという見た目と何かしらの効果がある特殊能力のようなモノを回収する事が主で、夢の中を歩き回って雰囲気を感じる事も出来る。

障害があればエフェクトを使って乗り越えたり、マップ内を地味に探索する事になる。

ゲームオーバーはないが一部のキャラクターに捕まると進めなくなることもあり、そういうときは頬をつねって（テンキー９）目を覚ますしかない。

[h1]良い点[/h1]
・全体を通した不思議な雰囲気と静かで急がさせられたり落ち着かされるBGMが作り出す没入感

・低確率での様々な変化とエフェクトの効果が何処で役立つかなど、何かを発見する楽しさ

・どこからでも（一部エフェクトがないと不便）探索できるので、やりたいように進められる。

[h1]悪い点[/h1]
・歩きが遅い。じてんしゃやバグ技を使いがちになるので人によっては面倒

・ストーリーがない。エンディングは一応あるが詳しくは語られないので訳が分からないかもしれない。

・同じマップをグルグルすることもよくあるし、少し複雑なルートを通らないと行けない場所もあるので、自力で見つけるのが少し難しい。

[h1]最後に[/h1]
かなり昔に一度最後までプレイしたことがあり、懐かしさを感じながらプレイしましたが大きな変化がなかったのが少々残念でしたっとこんな感想を抱きつつ、前に外付けHDDに保存したゆめにっきを起動してみるとバージョンが同じだったので当たり前だった。

結構人を選ぶし、どこが面白いか分からない人もそれなりにいるだろうが、無料ですし、やってみないとどこがいいのか分からないゲームですので、時間があったらおひとつウボァー……

39453985.review:
I played this game so long ago when it was being shared around by friends as some strange quirky game. It was an unofficial English version but it wasn't too important to read anyway. We all took our time exploring and we all had our own theories on what we were experiencing, but what we were experiencing was something strange and dark nevertheless.

It's worth a full play through, even if just to say you did it. Whether you enjoy it or not you can say you've tried it and probably take something interesting away from it. The visuals are bizarre, the effects are fun, and the looping ambiance is unsettling. 

I love this game, sometimes I just sit down and play it to get the feeling only Yume Nikki can give me. It's a fusion of dreamlike curiosity, unease, and comfort. 

Please play this game. It's free but it's worth so much more. Finding one of the older versions lying around the web is still kind of difficult, some don't work right, so this Steam version is pretty simple of a setup and welcoming to new players, a game you might not be able to experience otherwise.

When I heard that this was coming to Steam it was an instant re-download for me. 

I've played this game so many times I've memorized most of the maps...It's a game that hasn't lost it's charm even over the many years / times I've played it. It's a simple game that can, of course...get repetitive, but for the right people - It's a must play. Especially if you love these style games. Having no true text dialog minus when you pick up effects truly makes you question the symbolism the game has to offer.

39446432.review:
So Yume Nikki (translated to Dream Diary) is a game that caught my attention because it was A.) weird looking, and B) free. Those two go pretty well together. Usually. Welp, let's dive into Yume Nikki.

THE ATMOSPHERE: Right from the get-go, this is really what you want to be playing the game for. The atmosphere is what defines this game, and is possibly its only "selling" point. Yume Nikki is about a girl who lives in some dinky apartment with one room, a balcony, and a crappy game that gets old after 5 minutes. You've got a bed, though, so might as well sleep. And that's when you enter her dream. From there, very weird stuff happens, and when I say weird, I MEAN IT. This game is certainly not for the faint of heart, since it will make you feel incredibly anxious and sad. The imagery isn't what I would call top notch, but by god it's unique. You'll be seeing all sorts of things in this girl's dreams, scary and strange. Calling the music "ambient" would be an understatement, because it will make you feel downright isolated. If you're a fan of how Undertale made you feel, or maybe even those odd RPG maker horror games, then you'll certainly like the atmosphere of Yume Nikki. 3/3

THE GAMEPLAY: If you've played this game, then you'll probably argue "but Kaiser (me), this game isn't supposed to be about the gameplay! Why are you including it in this review?" Well, it is technically classed as a "game" in my library, and my official rating scale for games includes it, so here it is. I ain't giving any game a pass on this one. That being said, however, gameplay is obviously where this game doesn't really focus. The controls are simple, and the mechanics are easy to follow. Well, I say easy to follow, but the point of the game is that it ISN'T easy to understand, which in turn makes it work. You can interact with certain things, but most things in the game are oddly useless. This adds to the game's atmosphere, but does no favors for the gameplay. Once again, not a bad thing, but it's worth noting. The only real complaint I can come up with is that the game moves far too slowly, and unless you maybe find a bike, that walk will be your top speed. Also, f*** the maze. 1/3

THE PROGRESSION: One would think that a game with literally no goal would have no progression at all, right? WRONG. Despite being totally open ended, there is progression to be made in the game. Throughout the game, there are many effects to be had, each one changing the way you look and control. Some are useless, but others are very important to accessing certain areas. Somehow, the game's atmosphere carries the game so much that it really is the only thing that make's you want to keep playing. But you know what won't make you want to keep playing? The health bar. I usually try not to spoil anything, but screw it, I'll warn you: The health bar is completely useless. All the enemies kill you in one hit, so there's no need. The dev couldn't take it out, so there it is. But for some stupid reason, the game makes you think you need health by putting vending machines around the place. Why??? But regardless, the progression is rewarding and will make you keep wanting to explore more of this girl's dreams. 2.5/3

THE TECHNICAL ANALYSIS: Nothing to worry about on this front. The game runs smoothly, and there aren't any glitches (unless you're a speedrunner). I experienced a bit of stuttering, but that's probably just my computer. No crashes to report, and best of all, no game breaking bugs. 1/1

FINAL VERDICT: 7.5/10
Yume Nikki may not have a stellar score on my rating scale, but I suppose it's because it's quite a niche game; an acquired taste, if you will. Not everyone will want to explore a dream for hours on end, some people have lives to get back to. But if you ask me, it's a game worth checking out.

39446276.review: Personally speaking here (I did play the game previously) for new people playing: it'll seem boring and/or dull. simply walking around for hours and possibly just finding 1 effect or some how getting into hell maze for the first time with no guide is awkward. Let alone finding enemies for the first time or the "seizure warning not included" events. Even with that in mind, theres something amazing about this game. Bizarre images, getting lost deep inside this dream world, and just trying to figure out simply "why" is what really makes Yume Nikki attractive. My 3 or so hours on this game can't match how much more there is to explore in this game. It's a shame that currently theres no achivments and such for a game full of hidden events, but maybe this new game that's coming out will show us more to the dream world. Dialogue or not.

39440112.review:
I played this game for my first time way back in 2011. I thought that the game was boring and honestly terrible. That was a few weeks before my father died. I went into a serious depression. I had self harm feelings and I was very lonley. I felt as if no one was there for me. Thats when I came back to this game... and I loved it. Everything about the game, the art, the music, the mechanics, everything just made me smile. A real smile, a smile that I had not seen for months, maybe a year. I finally understood the game. I played it for hours upon hours, probably more than 74. The lone atmosphere that this game brings to me never fails to make me smile. Yes the game is strange, differant and "new", but if you are suffering from mental illness then this game is for you. If you ever feel lonely. this games for you, if you ever felt like you were not yourself then this game is for you. Really, there is no point to the game. Just walk, explore, be free. There are powerups called effects that one may pick up which can help you access other places in the game and continue to get more powerups. This game takes patiance and to find all of the secrets, all the rooms, and all the effects takes time but if you enjoy the game, that time fades away like nothing youve ever played. that is yume niki's talent and I love it for this. When I heard it was coming to steam and the dev came out into the public once more, I was excited beyond belief. I have notices there is more lag in the steam version and occationally some slow down that wasnt there before but altogather it was nice port onto steam.


TL;DR: This game is perfect for those who love a slower paced game. It is also for those who have things like depression. It's a game one has to take time to understand but it highly deserves praise.


Sorry for my crappy spelling mistakes, I am not a very good typer.

39439877.review:
[h1]This game was .:* incredibly influencial*:. in-between its original 2004 release and today! It shaped the genre for surreal pixel horror as we now know it.[/h1]

Let me assure you though, it is [i]not[/i] a grindy or dialogue-filled one! If you want a straightforward gaming experience, this isn't for you.

If you enjoy reading into psychological tones, mental immersion, simple-pleasures, surrealness, and classic pixel RPGs, then please oh please by all means allow yourself to experience this for yourself !! Most of where the game harbors its appeal is in losing yourself...so I reccomend that, if you enjoy these attributes in a game, you go in blind and appreciate things as they come and trust that a conclusion will indefinitely meet you in the end !
This is one of my favorite videogames, and I'm excited that its Steam release will allow others to experience it too ~

---
Don't let my playtime fool you, I have the original non-Steam release ~

39427597.review:
I remember playing this game way back and never finishing it. I forgot about this totally and now with it being on steam I relayed it and it just hit me with early 2000's nostalgia. You know, when times where simple and the internet wasn't as large as it is now. 
   Well now with that out of the way, I personally love Yume Nikki but, as other reviews say, the game might be for everyone. Basically, Yume Nikki is a game where you go around playing as this one chick named Madotsuki and explore her dreams. In these dreams you need to collect these called effects. These can be found in many different ways by simply interacting to an npc or by other special methods. The game has a ton of exploring in it and if you don't know what you are doing it can take pretty long to get all of the effects. Also I would totally recommend playing the game blind as it makes the experience of the game much more mysterious and fun in opinion.


[b] TD;LR I would definitely download Yume Nikki, even if you've played it already [/b]

39426482.review: MINOR SPOILERS AHEAD. Yume nikki is a cult classic game made by kikiyam. i have not yet finished the steam version but i have completed the non steam version before so far there hasnt been a difference. yume nikki is really damn weird but its not something that i would call a horror game it only has some creepy and disturbing aspects but it also has some normal things in it. the main goal in the game is to just explore and find as much things as possible you could argue that the main goal is to get all of the effects which yes you need all of the effects to beat the game but beating the game isnt too necessary. and the game has a ton of secrets like uboa monoko  Kyukyu-kun and more. yume nikki also has a place called the nexus. The nexus has 12 doors that lead you to different places like the graffiti world for example. Alot of the time a world woud just have some weird creatures with a looping song in the backround and maybe 1 or 2 effects. This is one of my complaints but it is a very very minor complaint. but when you dig deeper into a world the more you would find . Its not obvious at first when you look for stuff usually its hidden somewhere. yume nikki also has parts inspired by mother the first one which is pretty cool yume nikke has tons of nods to spirited away earthbound zelda and more. and i almost forgot the amount of yume nikki fan games dont get me started on how much there are i havent played yume 2kki or .flow ( which are considered the best yume nikki fan games ) because of some technical difficulties which i hope i get to fix. overall yume nikki is one of my favourte games of all time i give yume nikki a 7/10 (: . (and before you say thats bad i rate things like 123 bad 5 is ok 7910 is really good so yea)

39426124.review:
This game is really good, and disturbing at times. Most of the stuff doesn't make any sense on purpose, and you're wasting your time if you want to understand it, which makes me even more confused and I love it. A lot of the effects you get are pretty much pointless but they're pretty neat, and you need them all to beat the game. I reckon there should be achievements for getting the effects and also finding secrets, because there is lots of secrets. I've personally found the Eye Palm Effect and the Bicycle Effect the most useful. There's a remake of this coming out soon, and I absolutely can't wait (it better be worth it). Everything just works because it's just a dream, and dreams don't even need to make sense or be logical in any way. I like the small little feature where to save you sit on the desk and write in your dream diary, which is what the name of the game translates to. Some people think this was inspired by Undertale, either they are joking or being serious, either way no it's definitely not. This was made before Undertale, and also its nothing like Undertale seriously how in the fuck is it related to Undertale im seriously confused.

Probably the best thing to do in this game is to explore, it's a journey of a sorts with no real end, since there is so many things to discover. I have searched up where the effects are, but to be honest finding them is far more rewarding and, I don't really know the word, but it's an experience.

39411655.review: Been over 4 years since I last played Yume Nikki, albeit unfinished. I am glad this incredible game has [i]finally[/i] come to Steam, as it deserves a whole lot more attention. Was one of the first games made with RPG Maker 2003 that I ever played and possibly the whole reason I got into the programming/translation stuff in the first place. The soundtrack and ambient are simply stunning, and its original elements have inspired countless fangames and spiritual successors (such as .flow, Yume 2kki and even OFF, dare I say). I absolutely LOVE the TORININGEN and so many other characters/designs in this game!! It's an open-world with lots of exploring to do and countless mysteries to unravel. All in all, a MUST for anyone who loves indie games, with a slight psychological horror to it.

39408267.review:
Ahh, Yume Nikki. The game that birthed the surge in RPGMaker horror games, and increased the visibility of surreal indie games all over the internet. This game started the indie game revolution, as far as I'm concerned, and it directly inspired numerous famous and/or beloved titles, such as Undertale and LISA. Not even to mention the enormous amount of fangames created for it, many of them creative and special in their own right. I will always have a deep, loving place in my heart for Yume Nikki.

Personally, I think I prefer to play the original fan translation over this steam version. This one seems to have a number of immersion breaking bugs the original didn't (and, I mean, that can be a problem considering Yume Nikki might as well be called Atmosphere Immersion: The Game), and while it isn't exactly a flaw, it's very jarring to see some of the strange translations this version went with. I think they wanted to try and separate themselves from the fan translation as much as possible, but considering those translations are what the fanbase have known all the effects by and called them for 14 years, it's incredibly jarring to see them with different names, and some of the changes flat out don't work, like naming the Flute effect "Whistle" when it literally can't be anything but a flute. That may seem nitpick-y, and it probably is, but it just seems odd they would go so far out of their way to make every effect name different from the translations everyone has known them by for 14 years, to the point that some of the names can even be misleading on what the item actually is/does.

All that said, that doesn't make the steam version unplayable, of course, and the bugs can be patched out in the future. And regardless of whether you play this version or the fan translated classic, Yume Nikki is a game I'll always cherish and encourage others to check out. It's a very surreal, unsettling game, a cold, isolating game, and it will not be for everyone. Or even for most people. But it's an unforgettable experience that paved the way for many amazing games to come, and I hope this steam release helps more people finally give it a try.

39403751.review:
アートです。褒めているのではありません。
学生でも芸術家でも何かを使って、別の何かを表現しようという
試みそのもので、酒場を借りて開く個展や私立美術館の作品展示会に
参加した作品と同じアートです。

人間は理解出来ない物に原生的な恐怖を感じ、何かの説明文を付与
する事で、個人的な安心感を得ようとします。
未完成な物ほど勝手な解釈が一人歩きし、未成熟な人ほど解釈を
広げたがるのは、今に始まった事ではありません。

これは、その原生的な部分に触れてくる作品ですが、だから面白いか
面白く無いかという話ではなく、ふーんと思って見ればそれでいいだけです。

あとは検索でエンディングを見て、アンインストールしてもいいと
思いますし、興味が無いのならスルーしてもいい。
公共の場に置かれている、○○作という彫像と同じです。

ゲームとしては、エンディングがあるらしいという設定の元に、
投げっぱなしのマップをただ歩いていくだけの内容で、１００円でも
高いと思います。
芸術作品としては、人それぞれに価値を見いだすと思いますので、
タダでも高いという人も居れば、１万円の価値はあると思う人も
いると思います。

39399582.review:
С данной игрой знаком уже года 2, она является одной из моих любмых, вследствие чего был рад ее выходу в Стиме -
 повод перепройти. Тем более, что скоро нас, вероятно, ждет продолжение. Теперь к самой игре:
Yume Nikki - продукт необычный, даже странный, и понравиться он сможет далеко не всем. Здесь нет экшена, нет линейного и глубокого сюжета, нет диалогов. Все, что мы делаем в этой игре - просто ходим туда-сюда по нескольку минут, исследуем сны главной героини и ищем эффекты, дающие некоторые доп. способности. эдакий симулятор ходьбы. И судя по такому описанию, вполне можно сказать, что Yume Nikki - игра довольно скучная и неинтересная, однако это не так: сны главной героини наполнены абстракцией и тайным смыслом, который каждый для себя может понять по-своему; каждая из локаций хранит свои секреты и соединяется с другими, не менее запутанными, уровнями; саундтрек состоит из повторяющего двухнотного эмбиента (в игре есть только один нормальный полный трек), который однако хорошо сочетается с атмосферой происходящего и задает ощущение мрачности и неизвестности; здесь нет скримеров (может, пару штук), однако сама атмосфера сюрреализма напрягает и вгоняет в тревожное состояние, плюс и вышеупомянутый эмбиент делает свое дело; сюжета здесь как такового нет, да, зато есть намеки на то, что же все-таки происходит (или произошло) с главной героиней, повторюсь: каждый может интерпретировать их по-своему; сам мир игры довольно разнообразен - вы встретите много странных существ на своем пути.
Скажу еще раз, что данный продукт подойдет не всем: сначала немного поиграйте, чтобы решить для себя, благо, игра бесплатна. И если вы все решите продолжить играть, то мой вам совет - используйте вики, так как в игре много ходов и выходов, и найти их все самостоятельно будет достаточно сложно.

39383394.review: I remember playing this game years ago around when it first came out and the website I had to download it from was completely Japanese with no translation yet avail and having no clue wtf I was doing, but absolutely adoring it for the experience. This game in particular was no doubt the inspiration for and it some cases also directly spawned the creation of many, many other games over the years (the LISA series is directly related to Yume Nikki as LISA: The First was a Yume Nikki fan-game. LISA is an amazing game for those of that don't know. I've already experienced everything this game has to offer, but for all the people that haven't I wanted to leave this review and urge you to give it a chance and explore the game world on your own, without guides. There are so many rare and interesting little secrets and areas, some that you'll likely never come across unless someone told you about it, but you should definitely go into this game blind and after you had a few runs read up on it a bit to learn about everything you missed. Also, this game came out in 2004. The idiot "curator" that called this inspired by Undertale is a fucking joke. This game predates Undertale by more than 10 years.

39375390.review:
First released in 2004 Yume Nikki is one of Japanese cult classic RPG maker game  that inspired and created many other Yume Nikki derived games. Yume Nikki is a dream walking simulator that you control protagonist Madotsuki inside of mostly bizarre dream world and collecting effects that main charactor can equip. The level design and sound quality is ok considering this is a indie game made all the way back in 2004. But that also means this game might very boring if you don't consider those facts. You will be lost most of times and might have no idea where you are going. Although this is part of gameplay however don't be afraid to search up in the Yume Nikki Wiki if you have some place you want to visit. 
I personally looking forward to new Yume Nikki project that creator working hard to surprise us once again in the bizarre world of Yumme Nikki.

39375076.review:
Yume Nikki is a strange experience. I've played this game awhile back in 2004. The context I had was a lot of let's players were having a go at it, a lot of people were talking about it. These days, I don't feel like it's the same. You can't exactly immerse yourself in a fandom unless you really wanted to, all you have is intrigue alone. One good way to get into the game I recommend is searching up random events on YouTube in Yume Nikki. That would get you curious about the game in uncovering more.

Jumping into the game without knowing what to do would give you a pretty bad experience, especially the slow walking pace with the Bicycle Effect missable pretty easily. If you were to play this, make sure to look up on getting the Bicycle Effect before playing the rest of the game blind (if you're new).

I would definitely recommend this game with the described experience.

39363222.review:
ooh my goodness... i never dreamed i'd see yume nikki on steam, and.. dealing with kadokawa? lol..
playing this is quite a trip from the past for me and clearly demonstrated a lot of other people aha

.. it feels clunky for some reason. in the beginning, it probably actually isnt and is just memory. i managed to get to the floating tile world again in a couple minutes, and the experience and music just makes me cry, now. have to stop to write this ahaaa

new players, this game is, i would say the very best possible 'self-projecting' experience of a character in any media, period, imo. at least on the more somewhat darker end of the spectrum, and a very very rare example of silent protagonist that has enormous *character*, all due to the brilliant way Kikiyama made the game and all the many, many equally viable fan theories and ideas. honestly, while yume nikki standalone is great, the real experience has always kinda been the ideas and fandom of it, i think??

this game is a clear 10/10 for its atmosphere and the sheer openness and well.. just everything about Madotsuki. there isn't a whole lot of actual horror unless you find it yourself, in your own feelings (not hard to do if you get into theorycrafting and the character identification bits) though there certainly is some plain in the game that can happen.

certain songs are also very very nice. repititive without a doubt, but well the game in general is pretty repetitive in many ways. that isn't actually a problem for this one, though. the maps are usually simple type design but made incredibly well, some are very lovely with fitting themes and visual effects. pretty much if there was ever a go-to example of an immersive artwork in video game form, i'm completely convinced YN would be the #1 of (many, many) examples.

yume nikki is honestly an excellent portrayal of a type of lucid dream like experience, albeit not (usually) as fun as they can be. though again sometimes it can be. overall great game to sit down and relax with, in a calmer, thoughtful, and emotional kind of way.

// don't forget the eye that watches you through the tv the PARANOIA ;;;;

39360220.review:
Don't let my playtime mislead you, I've sunk at least 40+ hours in this game back in high school and at least 60+ on fanmade sequels (2-kki, .flow, and Misere, one of my favorite take on the series). This was the game that inspired me to take on many other awesome indie titles such as IB, Dreaming Mary, Wadanohara and Middens, with elements of surrealism and/or horror to them. 

If you really want to experience the game blind, here's my recommendation: Go into the fifth door, clockwise from the top of the nexus. Keep going west until you see a bicycle. Pick it up, then feel free to wander around. If you're really stuck or would like to see more of the game's secrets, consider searching for a guide on getting a lamp, a knife, and a stoplight (in that order). Those should get you the majority of Easter eggs in the game (and there are a LOT of them).

Ultimately, this is a game about exploration; the feeling that anything can happen in your dream. I'm incredibly hyped for the upcoming project, and fingers crossed that its a legit sequel.  

And finally, if you want to know in advance the biggest spoiler in the entire game, hover your mouse over the black squares below. You've been warned.

39359318.review:
This is an 'adventure' game about a girl who suffers autism. The girl refuses to leave her room, but can do so in her dream when she sleeps - this is the beginning of her dark adventure.

No stats are improved, but you need to obtain 'effects' which aid your adventure including bleaching some points where you couldn't pass by. So the game flow is: walking a map -> obtaining effect -> walking another map -> obtaining effect -> walking -> ...

The maps are incredibly large and designed like a maze, so you need to walk around for a very very long time. The environment is dark, creepy, insane, mysterious & dreamlike as the game title indicates.

If you're a path-finding adventure game fan, I'll strongly recommend this game - it's even FREE!

39355281.review:
Em uma época bem distante, onde eu não tinha internet em casa, e tinha que baixar jogos, grava-los em um CD da lan house, e jogar no pc que tinha em casa, numa dessas, eu baixei Yume Nikki.
Cara, nem sei te falar o que eu sinto por esse jogo. É bizarro, mas ao mesmo tempo, instigante. E olha que na época, eu não tinha acesso a fanbase e as teorias que rolavam desde que o jogo saiu. Eu jogava puramente por curiosidade, e a experiência foi... bizarra, mas incrivel.

Basicamente, é um Walk Simulator feito no RPG Maker. Mas não deixe isso lhe afetar. Você precisa dormir e sonhar pra tentar pegar cerca de 24 "efeitos" pra fechar o jogo. Pra pegar esses efeitos, você entra em vários mundos através de portas ou portais dentro desses mesmos mundos. Existem NPC's e "eventos" durante o jogo, porém, não há dialogos (pra não dizer que não tem... existem uns bichos que falam números...) e tudo é baseado na sua curiosidade e desejo de exploração.

Vale a pena jogar esse jogo, pela experiência que ele te fornece (e possiveis problemas mentais futuros). Apesar de bizarro e estranho (Creepy muitas vezes), ele te instiga a ir mais fundo, e enfim, criar a sua teoria para o que diabos está acontecendo. O criador do jogo não é conhecido por ninguém, e o mesmo não fala ou cita sobre o que exatamente é o jogo, então cada um tem sua visão ou teoria sobre o que diabos se passa no jogo. Existe uma ENORME fanbase que cria teorias e até sairam alguns jogos fãs baseados nessa obra.

Dica: Procure pela Bike primeiro pro gameplay ser mais rápido. Ela fica na Grafitti World, na porta roxa (que não pisca) na parte de baixo.

39355005.review:
I had no idea that this had been ported to Steam; and as soon as I heard, I dropped everything and rushed to the download page.
For those who don't know, Yume Nikki is an RPGMaker Horror Classic, and was released over ten years ago. I had seen playthroughs and played the game a bit years ago. To see it finally come to service like Steam is exciting as heck!
Now, as for the game's contents itself:
You play as a character named Madotsuki (which, funfact, means "Window"), and explore the world of her dreams. Your goal is to find all the effects while dodging enemies (that, honestly, just make you have to wake up and go back into the dream) and solving simple puzzles. Along the way, you see all sorts of landscapes (or should I say "dreamscapes"), creatures (both friendly and not), and hopefully find a few rare occurances too.
This is a game that has inspired so many games (fan-games and even legit projects), and has had homages and easter eggs in even more games. It's even had manga and novel adaptations, as well as music-based projects.
Please, do yourself a favor and play this RPGMaker Horror classic.

39348437.review:
I'll admit I was worried at first when I saw YN end up on Steam, but now I'm just so relieved and happy to see it brought back to life and in an easily accessible place so more people can find it. Yume Nikki is a very special game to me and so many others, and it's a mysteries thats's kept us all captivated since its first version in 2004 (or its most recent one in 2008 to the present, depending on what angle you're coming from).

I have to warn new comers to the game though: a lot of you are probably coming into this from Undertale, which is GREAT, but you genuinely cannot go into Yume Nikki thinking its going to be the same kind of game, or else you're going to be very disappointed. The sole connecting point between Yume Nikki and Undertale is that they're both inspired by Earthbound/Mother, and that's it. The point of Undertale is to showcase the power of kindness and give the player a sense of catharsis; Yume Nikki is a game meant to be experienced, meditated on, and theorized on. Yume Nikki is much closer to OFF in its bizarreness of the world, and played more like Journey, minus the set plot.

If you're a person who plays games solely to experience the story, it's probably going to be hard to get through Yume Nikki, a game with only bare-bone hints of a plot and no sense of direction. But I assure you, it's worth the time and wandering and exploration--if it wasn't, it wouldn't be on Steam now! Yume Nikki is a shining jewel in the RPG Maker games' history, and everyone who's played and loved it all these years are super excited you're here for the ride. c:

39343666.review:
Now before anyone gets this game, here is a little tidbit, this game is as serial and cryptic as it gets for anyone wishing to collect all the "effects" in this game. However, do not let that entice you into checking a guide at all for these because it is most enjoyably played when exploring the world and going through the game blind. Now to the actual review.

  Yume Nikki was one of the most popular rpgmaker games during the hype of that niche genre. Along with games such as IB, this game had a pretty good cult starting 14 years back. It is incredibly atmospheric and incredibly polished for the kind of game it was and quite frankly it also has some decent memories from back then involving scaring the shit out of one of my close friends at 3 A.M in the morning due to me screaming a bunch at a certain scene, you know who you are. 
   
  This is a game that I can guarantee you will enjoy if you like a good atmosphere as well as exploring a really surreal world, this game is quite frankly perfect for what it is. Instant 10/10 and will 100% it again.

39342378.review:
最近またいろいろと展開しているのは知ってたけど、まさかsteamで配信されるとは……昔プレイしたときのことを思い出してつい泣きそうになってしまった。当時、まだまだ発展途上だったSNSのファンコミュニティで夜通し語らったり非公式でガラケーに移植されたNASUをアホみたいに遊んでたりした……
…したよね……(遠い目)


[h1]どういうゲームなのか[/h1]
　夢の中をうろつくツクール製ゲーム。それだけ。
　エフェクトというお着替えアイテムを探してもよし、うろつくだけうろつくもよし。なんならベッドにすら入らないでずっとNASU食っててもいい。
　強くプレイヤーを動かす目的はないため、あてどなくさまようゲームが好きでない方にはちょっと向かないかもしれない。

　ききやま氏の卓越したデザインセンスによる、非常に精神をゆさぶってくるアートワークが特徴的で、強烈に人を選びつつもその異彩によってカルト的人気を生み出した作品である。
　トラウマになってしまうような精神的恐怖を味わえる一方、直接的なホラー表現はあまりなく、むしろほんわかとした場面も多い。怖いのか怖くないのかも判断しづらいが、いやそもそも広大なマップに配置されたオブジェクト自体に意味があるのか、意味は無いのか……。伏線があるんだか無いんだかそれすらもわからないという文脈のなさっぷりは「言葉のサラダ」のごとしである。
　謎への探究心からか、はたまた混沌に法則性を見つけて安心したいからか……そういった部分の考察をしたり、他のプレイヤーとの意見交換が活発に行われたことなども人気を呼んだ理由であろう。

・怖いだけのゲームなの？
　怖くないとは言えない。おそらくこの手の精神をぐらつかせてくるゲームをあまりプレイしたことのない方は2,3日ほど悪夢に苛まれたり、トイレに行くのが怖くなるかもしれない。それは確かである。

　しかし、慣れてくると徐々にある種の「心地よさ」を見出すようになる。かまくらの中でボーっとしたり、カリンバを延々と聴いたり、涙を流す足にどことなく優しさを見出したり……あるいは[spoiler]キャラクターを刺したとき[/spoiler]の反応を楽しんだり。目的がないゆえに何をしていてもよく、中毒性がある。
　ときに優しく、しかし恐ろしくもあり、その無秩序さとある種の平等さはまさに夢そのもの。いつのまにかランドルフ・カーターのように時間を忘れて放浪を楽しんでいた…なんてこともあるかもしれない。ありました(体験談)


・まとめ
　有名になった今では動画サイトなどで済ませてしまう人も多いかもしれないが、ぜひ一度触ってほしいタイトルである。いまなお人々を魅了してやまず、数多くのヒット作に影響を与えた作品でもあるので、ルーツを知るという意味でも試しにやってみてほしい。

　ポニ窓いいよね… …いい……

39342050.review:
Yume Nikki is a game I spent a long time with as a kid, so it's important to me. 
Feels like home.

Newcomers:
Goal: Collect the 24 effects. Use these effects to do different things in the dream world. Try different effects with different things. Remember the things you have seen, and if something changes, perhaps investigate it. 
Watch out for people that have beaks (Toriningen) Do not stab them if they are not hostile, because they will be. You cannot kill them, you can only run.
Not everything that looks scary will hurt you. Try interacting with different things.

39342011.review:
The RPG Maker game that gained a cult following and is often cited as the inspiration for many horror/surrealistic fan games. 

For those willing to give it a try, a surreal trip through a world of dreams awaits you. The game's appeal lies in making new discoveries as you go deeper and deeper with each visit. Maybe you'll stumble upon a monochrome world, or meet a pianist in space, or discover why it's a bad idea to mess with a light switch. Yume Nikki's abstract nature is thought-provoking and leaves it open to interpretation, which has led players to collaborate on theories in an attempt to explain what's happening in the game.

Yume Nikki has been around for years and it's one of the games I keep coming back to every now and then. Playing it has been a unique experience and definitely left a lasting impression for me.

I wonder what the dev was intending to do with this game. At first, I didn't really know if I should recommend this or not. I mean, it is a good game overall; you walk around dream worlds where you explore stuff, which was like a boring walking simulator to me tbh. When I got to play 0.1 hour more, though, I realised the dev was high while making this game, and I got high as well. Some Illuminati supporting Buddha in the background, alongside dead, ahegaokin Mews with their tounge out. What else could you ask for in a game from 2004? [spoiler] Sand lions would be nice.[/spoiler]

Though I think it'd be amazing if it had some horror content, or if some actions you took in the dream world would affect your IRL room (unlocking new rooms, removing your atari etc.). Either way, it's free and I think you should give it a shot.

39331054.review:
In Yume Nikki, you wander around a weird dream world with no objective except to take in the sights. There are effects to collect from various objects and creatures, ranging from purely cosmetic ones to others required to find some of the game's secrets. There is an ending if you collect every effect in the game, but I doubt anyone could find them all without getting bored of the game first. The dream world is confusing to navigate due to its size, looping screens, and a lack of landmarks to know where you've been. This, combined with how obscure a lot of the requirements to get effects are, makes me wonder why top reviews recommend playing this game blind as this game practially requires a guide. Unfortunately, getting lost in Yume Nikki is common and doesn't reward the player enough to justify the long sections of running around the same areas looking for something new, making the game extremely boring to me. I don't recommend Yume Nikki, but its free so there's nothing stopping you from giving it a shot and seeing if you can tolerate it.

[spoiler]I predicted the game's ending instantly by thinking "Why would the game have a balcony if the entire game is spent in be-[b][i]oh no[/i][/b][/spoiler]

39329240.review:
The last time I played this game was 7 years ago and the nostalgia I'm getting from it is insane. It's one of those games that reappears in your head for no apparent reason.

Yume Nikki(ゆめにっき, Dream Diary) is a japanese RPG game where you explore different paths into different dream realms as a girl named Madotsuki. As you explore different "realms" you gain new dream effects that can help guide you or are just there for fun; the game gets more interesting and intriguing as you dive deeper into dream worlds, the stuff you will see will make you question a lot of things. You recollect memories and effects to find something deeper than what is expected in her reoccuring dreams. 

They're no clear goals in the game. It's pretty much hard to explain the rest, so it's best that if you play it for yourself. 

Other RPG games that are similar to this in style or genre, that I recommend ALOT are...
IB, Mad Father, and Undertale. Also, Yume Nikki 2(Yume 2kki) which is a fan made sequal.

39328190.review:
Yume Nikki(The Dream Diary) ,(originally released in 2004) it's a game developed using "RPG Maker" (2003); which tells the story of Madotsuki, a young girl that for some reason don't want to leave her appartament; at least she's free on her lucid dreams, but not completely, her oniric world is held by Reccurring dreams.

Explore the lively and vast world inside Madotsuki's mind and collect her memories (effects) to open new paths in this Internet's classic; but don't get lost, you might find some dark places in the way.

Can you discover what is in Her mind?

がゲットできます、そのゲットした " エフェクト "　で " 彼女 " を変身させてみせましょう。" 彼女 "　が変身します。不思議な変身可愛い変身、怖い変身恐ろしい変身でも、怖がらないでください、これは " 夢 " です。

39324367.review:
This game changed my life. It introduced me to surrealism and kicked my love for atmosphere from a subconscious enjoyment to a conscious and knowing adoration for experiencing things. Playing Yume Nikki isn't playing a game like you would another game; the "game" is more akin to some kind of program that lets you explore areas and soak up dark, surreal atmospheres and see lots of unique designs and areas. Most walking simulators only give you a hallway, but Yume Nikki is incredibly generous and gives you 12 doors. I won't say what lies beyond those doors or what you're going to encounter, but know this; if you're the kind of person who'll get into this game, you probably won't finish it as the same person who started it. Even if you're not some atmosphere/experience junkie like I am you can still have a comfy time exploring and seeing all of the various areas just playing the game. If you decide to give Yume Nikki a try, I hope you have a great time with it. Know that you should probably be a patient person who's fine with roaming and seeing for a change from action and fighting; if you want something with intense gameplay, you should probably look elsewhere.

Yume Nikki isn't a horror game. Rather, it's a pretty uncomfortable game that you can, with time, learn to find comfortable. Don't go in expecting something that some YouTuber is going to scream about, go in expecting a strange, dark, isolated explorable museum of sorts, because that's honestly what you're going to get. Again, I hope you have as good of a time with this game as I've had with it, because to me it's one of the most legendary classics of all time.

39318251.review:
Aun recuerdo cuando jugue este independiente ahi por el año 2011, por que si, este juego realmente salio el año 2004. Su autor lo creo y dejo que vagara libremente por internet donde se fue haciendo conocido por esto mismo medio, por lo que el que saliera repentinamente en Steam sorprendio.

En resumen, es un juego creado con el RPG Maker y basicamente es un Walking Simulator. Somos una joven que por alguna razon no quiere salir de su habitacion y practicamente vive en el mundo de los sueños. No pareciera tener un objetivo claro y cuando lo descubres no sabes ni por que lo estas haciendo. La gracia que tubo este juego fue el cultivo de teorias que surgieron a partir de lo que veian los jugadores mientras hacian la travesia por el mundo de los sueños. Cuando se le pregunto al creador la razon y el significado de este no hubo una respuesta de cuales eran, pero si que habia un sentido en todo lo que estabamos viendo. Por lo tanto, se trata de ir viajando por este mundo onirico intentado interpertar los pensamientos de la protagnonista a travez de sus sueños y con esto construir la historia que vivio, mientras que el objetivo del juego es conseguir los "effectos" para asi llegar al final de este.

Es un juego que atrapa mucho por que la atmosfera llega a ser muy densa, intrigante y muy variada. A pesar de no ser del genero del terror si que muchos llegaron a tener esta sensacion por cosas que pasaban, al final de todo la cabeza humana puede ser un lugar que temer. Echenle un vistazo, caminen por los sueños de esta niña y que las teorias sigan, a ver si se llega a una respuesta definitiva.

39313968.review:
The game is very simple in concept (collect all of the effects and bring them to the Nexus) but takes a lot of time, exploration, some problem-solving, and a bit of luck. There are a lot of events (mostly easter egg type things not necessary to completing the game) that happen randomly and/or under specific circumstances. The entire game is unsettling, but not too stressful because there's no way for you to get hurt/die or lose any progress like the effects you've collected. The worst that can happen is you get lost or stuck, but you can always wake up and start again. You can do everything at your own pace and intepret as you please.

About Waifu Hunter's curator review: the game is NOT inspired by Undertale; Yume Nikki was originally released 2004 whereas Undertale came out 2015, so if anything, Undertale was inspired by Yume Nikki. The girl's name is Madotsuki, "yume nikki" is Japanese for "dream diary" The gender identity theory is a very loose theory about the meaning behind the game, but it's no more valid than any other theory. Everything is up to interpretation and varies from player to player.

39311990.review:
TLDR:  This game is old.  It comes from a time before youtube and steam became popular, where it wasn't that easy to post a bunch of hints everywhere.  You even had to search it out and download it yourself.  It suffers from being compared to newer games which have adapted to the times.

Elaboration:

This is not a game for people who want action.  For people who want clarity.  And since it was released so many years ago, people are bound to compare it to younger stuff that they're familiar with.

There were some reviews saying that this game has "bad graphics."  Sure.  There have been so many RPG Maker clones at this point that Yume Nikki doesn't really stand out visually.  While there is an enormous variety of visual content, someone just starting the game probably won't see enough of it to realize that.  

Yume Nikki was a pioneer because it was released just early enough before places like Steam really exploded.  You had to find it, download it yourself, and wander about with few places offering hints.  Gamefaqs was a lot bigger then, with little competition.  In those days it was much easier to get immersed in a game because you had so few people talking about it elsewhere, at least compared to now.

But for the most part, it's nonviolent.  Unfortunately, there's still violence in this game.  You can go on a horrible killing spree against creatures that won't do anything to you.  The ones that are "hostile" just teleport you someplace.  In that sense this game is probably appropriate for everyone.....  If it weren't for the horrific vibes and the blood and the surrealism.

Sure, I suppose I'm giving this a positive review out of nostalgia.  It's been so long that I've forgotten where the effects even are, so it's time for wanderin'.  Yume Nikki isn't a pleasant truck drive through the desert, no, it's leaping head first into a psychadelic abyss.  Still, at least nothing out to destroy you.  Relax.  Hope you won't have nightmares after playing this.

39309294.review: a cute little game that becomes dark and psychological and psychedelic just minutes in to the game. it's important to keep in mind that the game was originally released in 2004, as I see people saying that this game is copying off of undertale when in fact, if anything, it is the reverse. it's a game that explores the human condition and gender identity in an explorative and lucid way, closer to LSD dream simulator. Like LSD dream simulator, it was quite niche and unknown on release. Also in dream simulator a lot of the envioerment is interactive, running in to a wall or falling in a hole can take you to a whole different world and quite possibly a different dimension. yume nikki is no different. you open a door in this dream world thing, and you just go further in to the rabbit hole by interacting with bizaree life forms and finding different effects to use. my favorite aspect of it is how it captures a dream state or psychedlic state, what have you. it's unstable, random and absurd. that's what attracts me to this subject, whether it's movies like waking life or inecption or games like dream simulator and antichamber. however now that it's on steam I imagine a fanbase will grow (god forbid the fandom grow at the lengths of undertale smh.) but yes, it is a scenic game more about exploration rather then one fixed objective or mission, so if you like games with a steady objective or some form of combat, this one may not be for you. I still totally rec trying it tho! it's a choose your own adventure kinda thing, but a lucid and dark psychological one

In short: This seems utterly pointless.

Sure, it's free, but there are free games out there that are actually interesting and fun.

少數幾個有名的精神獵奇遊戲，以前作者免費公開在網路上自由下載，現在你可以不用安裝額外的rpg maker外掛，就可以直接享受這款異色作品

雖然是像素畫面，卻更加引發玩家的想像力，去推導角色"窓付き"角色的資訊，以及四周的關係。

為什麼不願意走出房間？為什麼流連於夢境，只為尋回那些「特質」？為什麼……

配合大量網路上玩家們的推理及延伸出各種作品，對於8bit game情有獨鍾，又喜歡特殊題材的人，請試試這特別的《夢日記》。

操作說明：
https://wiki.komica.org/index.php?title=夢日記&mobileaction=toggle_view_mobile

輸入鍵               	                                             功能
←↑↓→、HJKL        	                                 主角移動。
Enter、Z 、Space	                                         打開門、向特定NPC取得效果、調查和把蛋回收變回效果。
0、Numer 0、ESC鍵、Insert鍵、XCVBN	 開啟或關閉選單。0、Numer 0鍵在FCの世界、FC小屋中會失效。
1、Numer 1	                                                 特殊功能一。
3、Numer 3	                                                 特殊功能二。
5、Numer 5                                               	(門の世界限定)把使用中的效果變成蛋，也可把蛋回收變回效果。
9、Numer 9                                                  	捏臉頰，如果主角身處夢境中，捏臉頰後會醒來。
F4	                                                                切換成視窗化或全螢幕化。
F5                                                             	調節遊戲畫面的大小。
F12                                                             	馬上回到選擇はじめて、ゆめにっき、おわり的最初畫面。

This game is both unsettling and surreal; there is no dialogue, only your character Madotsuki and her dreams (nightmares).
You'll spend a majority of your time exploring different areas and putting bits and pieces together on just what happened to cause these nightmarish dreams that Madotsuki is having, all the while feeling a sense of unease thanks to the unsettling (and anxiety inducing) ambiance and music. 

There is no clear cut story, so the final story itself is up to the interpretation of the actual player. It's hard to do this well, but this game absolutely nails it.

39301092.review: Basically a walking simulator. Dialogue? None. Story? Not really. So, what's there to expect? Easy; an unsettling journey through the dreams of Madotsuki, an apparent isolated young girl who refuses to leave her apartment when in reality. There's many interpretations of this game, yet I think only you can come up with one, since everyone's bound to have a different experience. There's nothing about this game that I can say I dislike, it's such a unique experience that truly is the start of creepy and subliminal RPGs. (and no, it was NOT inspired by Undertale. Yes, Uboa looks like W.D. Gaster. But if you just do your research, you'll know that Yume Nikki came first. Yume Nikki was available to the public way before the Steam release. It was originally released in 2004) But anyway, I definitely recommend this game, which is so unique and special that it's definitely worth a try. Have fun trying not to get lost and collecting every Effect!

39298774.review:
First of all, I've loved this game for many years and had a story reserching fan theories about it, also my own investigations and a lot of sweet dreams about this game, but I'm no fanboy, not of this or of any other thing, I just love it and my personal record was beating it in about 46 minutes with no guide.

Nostalgia aside, this game is good for anyone that likes bizarre exploring, being thrown in a world where you can discover many things that could be related to the mind of the developer or the actual character you are playing as, that's because you really are exploring Madotsuki's (protagonist) dreams, endless worlds looping themselves and linking to each other in many ways, some of them are gate to one or even more different dreams, there are hidden events that could be seen as nightmares and many things to discover, this being said, it sounds like a master piece and it is a master piece and a cult game, so let's go to the pros and cons.

Pros:
-Simple controlling.
-Awesome ambientation (soundtrack).
-Colorful scenarios as well as deep and dark mixtures (Graphic ambientation).
-Lots of secrets and exploration.
-Lots of fan theories.

Cons:
-No actual story (most of it is fan based theories).
-No dialogs.
-Not as newbie friendly as it looks like (must play with a guide).
-Too cryptic at some points.
-Harsh critics are not welcomed by fans (really guys, there are people that play a lot of games).
-People thinking this game was inspired by Undertale (do your reserch guys, I think you can still find kikiyama's original game).

Summary:
Even if it's a master piece and has a design that goes far beyond masterful and complex, the game is not lacking on an interesting ambientation, but is lacking on welcoming the casual gamer, it fails on making itself interesting given that it doesn't have a motivation inside the game to keep looking around, your goal is only getting the effects and watching the ending, sounds boring, but it's not like that for some others, because looking for the effects is only the main game, but there are lots of things to explore, like the Madotsuki ghost, Uboa, the Toriningen picnic, and much much more hidden stuff that only the more curious and sometimes stubborn can find on their own and that's why I do recommend this game to the ones that are curious and want to explore a wonderful universe.

39296220.review:
TL:DR An RPG Maker classic, bewilderingly released on Steam after all these years. This is recommended for people with the patience and time to wander a surreal world freely, and ponder the imagery within.

For those not in the know, Yume Nikki (translated to English as "Dream Diary") is an atmospheric horror/exploration game revolving around the mysterious shut-in, Madotsuki. Since they refuse to leave their room for... whatever reason, players instead explore the expansive realm of Madotsuki's dreams. The dream world begins with huge, often abstract worlds with loose themes. But if you explore further, you can find the more interesting bits like sewers filled with strange artwork, a vast sea of pink water, and a monochrome wasteland filled to the brim with surreal creatures and objects.  There's even a world styled after old NES games. Scattered around these worlds are "effects", powers that change Madotsuki's appearance, and gives them some small ability to change the world around them. They're mostly a means to an end... rather, THE end.

The true goal of this game is... well, up to the player. The player decides how far they want to go, and in which direction. The beauty of it is how it emulates real dreaming: All of the game's worlds open up and sort of bleed into one another with no regard for continuity. And for all it's bizarre locales, not once will an NPC show up and explain what it's meant to be: again, the game places all the interpretation up to the player. As such, you'll find people discuss to no end what every bit of the game's content means to them personally. 

It's not a "2deep4u" game and it's not trying to show off how much philosophy it knows. The game simply opens itself to you and says "this is what the game is. What do you think?" And for people that have the time to explore and ponder such things, they will find a strangely compelling game in this.

Also, if you enjoyed this game, I would check out it's MASSIVE fangame list, and I'd recommend:
-.flow
-Yume 2kki
-Yume Nisshi
-Answered Prayers

39294463.review:
Yume Nikki is... well, it's not a game for everyone. There isn't much to spoil, and that is because the experience this game give you is not something that can be spoiled, unless it truly wasn't for you in the first place. You walk around aimlessly in very big rooms with seemingly random landmarks, and see what you find. That is the whole game. Maybe what you find is one of the twenty or so effects, powerups which are the only thing you have to kind of tell how much "progress" you've made through the game. You can google their location if you want, too. They are kind of important, but they're not the entire game, so spoiling that won't actually spoil the game. You can google the ending, too. I personally think it's better enjoyed when you get to it by yourself, but again it won't spoil the game. The game isn't about a story, or at least not in the way games usually are. So what is this game about? I said it already, it's about walking aimlessly through very big rooms and seeing what you find. No I'm not joking. Yes this is the entire game. That "Walking Simulator" tag is very serious, too. So what's the appeal in a game about just walking around aimlessly? Well, that's what I mean when I say this game is not for everyone. If you rather a game where you are... well, doing literally anything besides just walking around, then this is probably not the game for you. That's ok, you aren't missing out on much if you weren't going to enjoy the game anyway, some people like their games to have... well, gameplay. But for the few that stayed, this game is about to blow your hecking mind.... if you are into the thrill of exploring a mostly empty wasteland, that is.
As far as the atmosphere goes, this game does an excellent job of getting you "in the mood". The music, the level design, just about everything feels the way it was intended to. And thats a very specific choice of words there, because the way it was intended to feel is not necessarily the way you would want it to feel. 

This game feels like a dream.

Really, though. Let's play a game: when you are feeling sleepy tonight, turn the game on and start playing until you fall asleep. And then, the next morning, try and remember which parts of your memories were part of the game, and which you were dreaming. It's at it's most obvious there, something I discovered playing more nights than I should have as a child, then regretting it at school the next day. But even when you aren't about to pass out, this game legitimally feels like a dream. It's non-sensical, it's weird, it's funny and a bit disturbing. It seems to last forever when only a few minutes have passed, and before you noticed it you've been playing all night. It seems like it doesn't mean nothing and it's just a random cluster of things, but it also makes so much sense, that you might actually be onto something here. And people did, oh golly if they did, because it just leaves you with that feel that all this randomness is actually a facade for a deeper meaning. And the more you play it, the more you realize, it's just like a dream. I actually have troubles remembering all the time i spent on this game as a child, because all the memories I have are so blurred, and I'm almost 100% sure it's not because I played exclusively at night, when I should be sleeping. No no, because I've played now, although a significantly smaller amount of time, and it feels the same, even though I literally was playing last night. Or was it the night before? See, I can't tell, it's all just too blurred to tell accurately.

Now, that might just be me, or maybe you dont get that feeling. Again, this isn't a game for everyone, and not everyone has the amount of time and willingness to go through this. If you don't particularly enjoy being asleep, this game is going to bore you to death, because, well, it's literally making you fall asleep, or at least it's giving you the feeling that you are. But if you are willing to go in, to get lost in literally nothing, to stare at your screen as it spews a bunch of colors and as your headphones make a bunch of noises and to find yourself having a blurred memory about it the next day, then this game, this game right here, is going to blow the everloving hell out of your mind.



And it's hecking free.

39293838.review:
As soon as I saw this game had been released on steam, I immediately downloaded it without a second thought, just to have it on my steam library. I played this game around 2-3 years ago and I loved it. This game is incredibly important, it is the first game I know of to use rpg maker game for something other than, well an rpg. It was a game that began (as far as I'm aware after brief research)  a generation of rpg maker horror games, such as Ib, The Witch's House, and Mad Father. showing that rpg maker could be used for more than rpgs (ironicly) it could be used to tell stories  and for horror. This game also spawned an absurd amount of fan games, some of the more notable ones are .flow and Yume 2kki.

Now onto the game itself, the game follows the dreams of a girl named madotsuki, a girl who never leaves her room, for unknown reasons. The girl never speaks, but we learn so much about her through the show don't tell prinicple ( this game is the embodiment of that imo) we see her fears, her memories, places from her past, people or things improtant to her. all without any dialouge at all. Due to the nature of this game nothing is set in stone, so who you think Madotsuki is, is your conclusion to draw. Theres something relateable about walking through a dream, I'm certain that Madotsuki has fears the player can relate to. what those fears may be I won't say because 1. I don't remember much about this game besides the general ideas and how good it is and 2. I want you to find them yourself. 
We all have reasons to fear going outside.

the gameplay is quite straight forward, you walk around and see the sights. The "goal" of the game is to find all the "effects", items that give madotsuki more actions. ( I would recomend finding the bike effect as soon as possible by looking up it's location as it allows you to move much faster, therfore allowing you to see more, more quickly.) Certain effects are required to go deeper into madotsuki's dream. and the deeper you go the more intresting it gets. However to start out, you have nothing but the clothes on your back, and the only area you can immediately acsess is the "nexus" a hub that leads to a few diffferent worlds, which leads to even more worlds.
I reccomend you try this game out, it can run on a potato and its very small, give it a shot to see if you are intrested. 

I hope you have a nice dream~

39293120.review:
Yume Nikki is one of the most enigmatic games of all time, released by an anonymous developer known as Kikiyama back in the mid-2000s. In a nutshell, it is an RPG Maker game with an emphasis on exploring weird places and collecting items. I will straight away admit that this is NOT a game for everyone. It's a game that rewards those with patience and persistence, not those seeking immediate gratification or a linear story.

The premise is that you're a girl simply called Madotsuki ("windowed") and you have the ability to traverse mysterious and bizarre dreamscapes. Along the way, you will encounter some dark imagery and hideous creatures. Your main goal is to collect 24 items called Effects, which changes Madotsuki's appearance and even grant her certain abilities. You may also explore more of the worlds to discover some interesting easter eggs.

One of the game's most notable traits is its lack of narrative. There is no dialogue to speak of and we don't know why Madotsuki sees the strange things in her dreams. Nearly everything we encounter is entirely up to player interpretation. All we can do is observe and discuss.

The game's cult status inspired more RPG Maker games with a similar premise and game mechanics, such as .flow and Yume 2kki (both of which I highly recommend if you love Yume Nikki). It also inspired indie developers Toby Fox (Undertale) and Dan Salvato (Doki Doki Literature Club!) due to its unique imagery and mysterious themes.

I have written a full review of this game back in 2016. Follow this link if you're interested in reading: http://breakingcanon.com/yume-nikki/

Personally, I consider Yume Nikki to be a work of art. The game's themes of isolation, confusion and distress struck a chord within me, as they did with many others. I'm happy that this game is back in the limelight again and I hope it gets its due justice when that countdown timer reaches 0.

39292132.review:
Yume Nikki es uno de esos juegos nativos de los foros de juegos "RPG making" de terror que lleva años dando vueltas por internet, como Ib, Mad father, Mogeko Castle, y largo etc. Es uno de los juegos que más leyendas urbanas ha creado a su alrededor, plagado de teorías sobre la oniromancia y algún que otro leve creepypasta. No quiero decir con todo ello que sea un juego que de miedo, es algo más.

Es uno de esos juegos que habla al jugador sin decir nada. Tiene esa magia que sólo unos pocos juegos hasta día de hoy tienen, ampliando su definición a más allá de videojuego. Yume Nikki es una experiencia de vida, a la cuál todos deberíamos enfrentarnos. Miedo, soledad, inseguridad, expectativas que se truncan y se rompen, esa sensación de que nada puede salir tan mal ya que eres tú el que tiene la sensación de controlar todos los factores que te rodean, pero no, no es así.

Ahora, a nivel jugabilístico, Yume Nikki ofrece exploración, terror psicológico, una BSO única y un dibujo de autor que consigue una atmósfera inmejorable. Olvidaos de que un NPC os diga por dónde tenéis que ir, es ensayo y error, e iréis varias veces por el mismo camino como observadores de la historia de Madotsuki (el nombre de la única protagonista).

Si puede ser, jugad éste juego sin presiones sobre vosotros. Tomaos vuestro tiempo. Disfrutad de la magia del diaro de los sueños y dejad atrás el plano real para explorar un mundo onírico lleno de criaturas toscas y sucesos demenciales.

39290728.review:
This game is absolutely not for everyone. I believe it's for two kinds of people: weird people, and patient people.

I'd classify this as an art game, and as an art game there's A LOT of negative space in it. As someone who's explored Yume Nikki in-depth before its Steam release, it took me some time to realize that this game does indeed have a point despite its empty presentation. It's not about what you can actually do or accomplish, but simply about seeing and being. Being a character in the form of a small girl whose mind may remain an enigma for as long as we can dissect it.

To me personally, Yume Nikki is a form of meditation; fewer games just let me melt into my chair and press a few buttons while I listen to strange droning music and see funny creatures without fear of really dying (once you realize that's the kind of thing it is). I can't speak for everyone, but this game is relaxing. I still come back to it even after I've seen everything and achieved the true ending. The flute and witch are my favorite effects. 
Are you weird and patient? Try Yume Nikki.

“Предел тупости — рисовать яблоко как оно есть. Нарисуй хотя бы червяка, истерзанного любовью, и пляшущую лангусту с кастаньетами, а над яблоком пускай запорхают слоны, и ты сам увидишь, что яблоко здесь лишнее.”

Yume Nikki (Дневник Сновидений) — это артхаусная, сюрреалистичная и мрачная игра бродилка о девочке хикикомори, которая путешествует по своим галлюциногенным снам воспоминаниям, которые в большинстве своем являются кошмарами, построенными на воспоминаниях главной героини.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1266792430

Эта игра, так же, как и Undertale черпала вдохновение из Earthbound, но в тоже время в отличии от нее, в игре нет сюжета, нету какой бы то ни было логики происходящего, нету диалогов и строгой повествовательной линии.

Единственная цель в игре — это собрать все 24 эффекта разбросанных по самым разным локациям, какие-то эффекты что-то делают, к примеру ножом можно убить, а фонарем осветить путь, а некоторыми типа Неона и Полотенца, ничего нельзя сделать или можно, но в любом случае дальше визуальных изменений ничего не произойдет.

Что в принципе объясняется тем, что игра не доделана и имеет версию 0.1, даже с учетом того, что в игре есть концовка. И версия в Steam, даже будучи выложенной спустя практически 13 лет от оригинальной игры ничем не отличается.

И возможно эта игра так и затерялась бы среди бесконечного количества похожих игр, сделанных на RPG Maker, если бы не огромное количество вложенного труда в, на первый раз достаточно бесполезные вещи, которые легко упустить.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1265656098

Ведь практически любую местную локацию в игре, можно выдавать за готовую артхаусно-пиксельную картину и таких вещей действительно много и их хочется исследовать, с ними хочется взаимодействовать.

Хочется путешествовать по снам этой девочки и удивляться, тому насколько правдоподобно воссоздал автор эти сны, ведь реальные сны, будем честными так же абсурдны, как и представленные в игре.

Музыка и общий антураж действительно нагоняют страху, а какие-нибудь монстры на заднем фоне действительно пугают, даже если ты и знаешь, что они нарисованные.

Единственная проблема, которая, пожалуй, действительно раздражает в игре — это ее невероятная медитативность и медлительность, а точнее только медлительность, ведь главная героиня Мадоцуки ходит ну о-о-о-о-чень медленно, при том, что локации, то достаточно не маленькие.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1265644165

Так что, если вы все же решите сыграть в игру, настоятельно рекомендую в самом начале игры в мире графити (шестая дверь) идти направо и взять велосипед, который позволит вам передвигаться гораздо быстрее.

В конце хочется сказать, что я вообще не люблю бездумные бродилки, но Yume Nikki своей полной бредовостью происходящего заставила меня пересмотреть свои взгляды, даже не удивительно, что на фоне остальные проектов игра стала по настоящему культовой.

+Бредовые сны
+Артхаус
+Эффекты

-Скорость

9 из 10

Кураторская группа: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/IKCB

39286617.review:
Played this yeaaaars ago... LOVED it! Still had it installed after all this time, but thought to just get it here too for a review. 

This game upon discovery spawned a huge cult following all over the internet (uboachan for one, and the yumenikki wiki with massive amounts of varied fangames)... It's very unique for an rpgmaker game. Very experimental, and calming. Lots of nice music and interesting visuals, starring obvious influence from things like paracas art, the MOTHER games...

Don't expect fighting and such like an rpgmaker rpg game would have. This is very much about exploration and the theories in your head you can create from your encounters around a strange world. It is NOT a typical rpg, but created on an engine originally intended for them. Not much for action except for outrunning certain enemies, but if you enjoy dreamlike environments it's worth a check out for being free. 

The game revolves around Madotsuki, a girl who has become rather hermetic... She takes refuge in her dreams and in each door to these worlds, you can discover a certain power that can aid your journey to discovering new places. These powers can interact with some of the creatures you might find.

Very happy to see this be on Steam and hope there's more exciting things to come!

39286522.review: Yume Nikki (dream diary) is an odd experience. You are given this huge amount of freedom to do whatever you want and go where ever you want. It took me about 2 days to finish the game (and by finish I mean gave up after getting most of the effects). I enjoy the games weirdness and cast of odd and silent characters. For game made in RPGM 2003, it still lives up to this day. Yume Nikki will go down as one of my many favorite RPG games and may even be one of the most famous freeware horror game. I recommend this to anyone. Can't wait to see what the up coming yume nikki project has in store.

39286395.review:
For playing this and beat it (As well as doing speedruns), I have to say I love this game and can say its on my top ten favorite games of all time. The surreal enviroment, the music, and the mystery of what going on in her head spark the community to create theories [No Spoilers]. To me, this game is a great example of making a game into art.

That said, the games does have minor issues, the biggest one is the cryptic of the game and most usually have to go for a guide to kinda figure out what to do [Me included.] But this can be a counter-argument as to me the game is meant to be explored, not beaten like a traditional game. 

I do recommend playing yume nikki and soaking in the atmosphere and get lost in the dream realm and enjoy yourself.

39284060.review:
日本だけにとどまらず、世界各国でカルト的な人気を博したツクール製フリーゲームの金字塔的作品です。
これほどまでに絶大な人気を博したのは他でもなく、制作者である [b]ききやま[/b] 様の、徹底した世界構築の妙技にあるのだと思います。
主人公の少女が自身の夢の中を探索する、という設定であるため、ゲーム内に存在する人物・背景・音楽、その他全ての要素が彼女のバックボーンに直結します。それ故考察の余地は尽きることなく、プレイヤーの数に比例して様々な解釈が発生しました。

ストアページ内の紹介文に表記されている通り、明確なストーリーや指針等はほとんどありません。
強いて言えば、特定のオブジェクトをアクティべートした際に獲得できる「[u]エフェクト[/u]」を集めることが目的です。
今作の骨子をレビューしようとすると粗方ネタバレに繋がるので(ほんとは書きたいけど！)自重させていただきますが、どうしてもお勧めしたい点があるので一つだけ・・・！

それは、このゲームにおける陰の立役者と言っても過言ではない、[b]ききやま[/b] 様謹製のBGM・SEです。
一貫して環境音やアンビエントで統一されていますが、ストーリーの無いこの世界を「音で物語る」装置として的確に機能しています。時には不安を煽り、また色彩の豊かな場面では安らぎを演出する、丁寧且つ緻密な配置には脱帽です。

決して万人向けなゲームではありませんが、今もなお独自の魅力を放ち続けるこの「作品」が、Steamというコミュニティを通して世界に再発信されることを非常に喜ばしく思います。
とにかく癖のあるゲームがやってみたい！という方は是非プレイしてみてください。
[strike]NH〇Kの日曜美術館が好き、という方にも刺さるかも！[/strike]

39282815.review:
It's hard to describe Yume Nikki, because until it was made there really wasn't anything like it, and even now the only games that come close to recreating its feeling are its numerous fangames, hundreds of them, all inspired by this one hidden gem.
If you enjoy surreality, themes of isolation, sadness and the unexplained, this is the game for you. The events that happen and the things you see in this game are so bizarre and often disjointed with the rest of the game that every area feels like something new.
There's a very particular feeling to this game. The music is entirely seamless loops, often around two seconds in length. You'll often find yourself walking around an area with no idea where you are in relation to the rest of the world, with the edges of the screen acting like some sort of obscuring fog. These design choices are odd, and mean that you really do need patience to enjoy this game - but you will definitely feel like you're walking endlessly in a dream, lost in the layers of doors that can lead you anywhere. As it's been put before, no other game has so closely recreated the feeling of being in a dream.
There's also a definite air of mystery about this game. Its creator never says a word about anything and there's no dialogue in this game whatsoever. Your mind will fill in all the gaps. Interestingly, the event that's broken this sensation most was this game's recent rerelease for Steam, and the announcement of a new project from the creator.

I definitely recommend Yume Nikki. Depending on how you interpret its bizarre and occasionally horrifying scenes, there's no theme that it shies away from and it's nigh impossible to get used to its winding paths and many worlds.
